standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Equations with variables on both sides

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   b    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4b+5&=1+5b \\\\ 4b+5 \blueD{-5b} &= 1+5b\blueD{-5b} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract }5b\text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -b+5&=1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -b+5\blueD{-5} &= 1\blueD{-5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract }5\text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -b &=-4 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-b}{\blueD{-1}} &= \dfrac{-4}{\blueD{-1}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by }-1\text{.}}\\\\ b &= \greenD{4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$b = \greenD{  4     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   d    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2d+4&=10+5d \\\\ 2d+4 \blueD{-5d} &= 10+5d\blueD{-5d} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $5d$ from each side.}}\\\\ -3d+4&=10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -3d+4\blueD{-4} &= 10\blueD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $4$ from each side.}}\\\\ -3d &=6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-3d}{\blueD{-3}} &= \dfrac{6}{\blueD{-3}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-3$.}}\\\\ d &= \greenD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$d = \greenD{  -2     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    b   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 7b-15&=5b-3 \\\\ 7b-15 \blueD{-5b} &= 5b-3\blueD{-5b} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $5b$ from each side.}}\\\\ 2b-15&=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2b-15\blueD{+15} &= -3\blueD{+15} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $15$ to each side.}}\\\\ 2b &=12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2b}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{12}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $2$.}}\\\\ b &= \greenD{6} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ b= \greenD{   6    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   d    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4d-4&=5d-8 \\\\ 4d-4 \blueD{-5d} &= 5d-8\blueD{-5d} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $5d$ from each side.}}\\\\ -1d-4&=-8 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -1d-4\blueD{+4} &= -8\blueD{+4} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $4$ to each side.}}\\\\ -1d &=-4 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-1d}{\blueD{-1}} &= \dfrac{-4}{\blueD{-1}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-1$.}}\\\\ d &= \greenD{4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ d= \greenD{   4    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   n    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2-2n&=3n+17 \\\\ 2-2n \blueD{-3n} &= 3n+17\blueD{-3n} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $3n$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5n+2&=17 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -5n+2\blueD{-2} &= 17\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $2$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5n &=15 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-5n}{\blueD{-5}} &= \dfrac{15}{\blueD{-5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-5$.}}\\\\ n &= \greenD{-3} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ n= \greenD{    -3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $s       $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 8-4s&=s+13 \\\\ 8-4s \blueD{-s} &= s+13\blueD{-s} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $s$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5s+8&=13 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -5s+8\blueD{-8} &= 13\blueD{-8} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $8$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5s &=5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-5s}{\blueD{-5}} &= \dfrac{5}{\blueD{-5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-5$.}}\\\\ s &= \greenD{-1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$s = \greenD{ -1      }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $a$ by itself.

$\begin{align} 5 + 14a &= 9a - 5 \\\\ 5 + 14a \blueD{- 9a} &= 9a - 5 \blueD{- 9a} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $9a$ from each side.}}\\\\ 5 + 5a &= -5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 5 + 5a \blueD{-5} &= -5 \blueD{- 5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $5$ from each side.}}\\\\ 5a &= -10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{5a}{\blueD5} &= \dfrac{-10}{\blueD5} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $5$.}}\\\\ a &= \greenD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$a = \greenD{-2}~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    a   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} a-15&=4a-3 \\\\ a-15 \blueD{-4a} &= 4a-3\blueD{-4a} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $4a$ from each side.}}\\\\ -3a-15&=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -3a-15\blueD{+15} &= -3\blueD{+15} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $15$ to each side.}}\\\\ -3a &=12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-3a}{\blueD{-3}} &= \dfrac{12}{\blueD{-3}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-3$.}}\\\\ a &= \greenD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ a= \greenD{   -4    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $  e     $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 9e-7&=7e-11 \\\\ 9e-7 \blueD{-7e} &= 7e-11\blueD{-7e} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $7e$ from each side.}}\\\\ 2e-7&=-11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2e-7\blueD{+7} &= -11\blueD{+7} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $7$ to each side.}}\\\\ 2e &=-4 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2e}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{-4}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $2$.}}\\\\ e &= \greenD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$e = \greenD{    -2   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $     c  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 12c-4&=14c-10 \\\\ 12c-4 \blueD{-14c} &= 14c-10\blueD{-14c} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $14c$ from each side.}}\\\\ -2c-4&=-10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -2c-4\blueD{+4} &= -10\blueD{+4} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $4$ to each side.}}\\\\ -2c &=-6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-2c}{\blueD{-2}} &= \dfrac{-6}{\blueD{-2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-2$.}}\\\\ c &= \greenD{3} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ c= \greenD{    3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on opposite sides of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    g   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} -3+5+6g&=11-3g\\\\ 2+6g&=11-3g &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2+6g \blueD{+3g} &= 11-3g\blueD{+3g} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $3g$ to each side.}}\\\\ 9g+2&=11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 9g+2\blueD{-2} &= 11\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $2$ from each side.}}\\\\ 9g &=9 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{9g}{\blueD{9}} &= \dfrac{9}{\blueD{9}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $9$.}}\\\\ g &= \greenD{1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$g = \greenD{     1  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   f    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} -f+2+4f&=8-3f\\\\ 2+3f&=8-3f &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2+3f \blueD{+3f} &= 8-3f\blueD{+3f} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $3f$ to each side.}}\\\\ 6f+2&=8 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 6f+2\blueD{-2} &= 8\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $2$ from each side.}}\\\\ 6f &=6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{6f}{\blueD{6}} &= \dfrac{6}{\blueD{6}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $6$.}}\\\\ f &= \greenD{1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$f = \greenD{ 1      }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    m   $ by itself.

$\begin{align}-7+4m+10&=15-2m\\\\ 4m+3&=15-2m&&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 3+4m \blueD{+2m} &= 15-2m\blueD{+2m} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $2m$ to each side.}}\\\\ 6m+3&=15 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 6m+3\blueD{-3} &= 15\blueD{-3} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $3$ from each side.}}\\\\ 6m &=12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{6m}{\blueD{6}} &= \dfrac{12}{\blueD{6}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $6$.}}\\\\ m &= \greenD{2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$m = \greenD{  2     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    h   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 17+4h+2&=1-5h \\\\ 19+4h&=1-5h &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 19+4h \blueD{+5h} &= 1-5h\blueD{+5h} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $5h$ to each side.}}\\\\ 9h+19&=1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 9h+19\blueD{-19} &= 1\blueD{-19} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $19$ from each side.}}\\\\ 9h &=-18 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{9h}{\blueD{9}} &= \dfrac{-18}{\blueD{9}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $9$.}}\\\\ h &= \greenD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$h = \greenD{  -2     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    k   $ by itself.

$\begin{align}20-6+4k&=2-2k \\\\ 14+4k&=2-2k &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 14+4k \blueD{+2k} &= 2-2k\blueD{+2k} &&\small\gray{\text{Add $2k$ to each side.}}\\\\ 6k+14&=2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 6k+14\blueD{-14} &= 2\blueD{-14} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $14$ from each side.}}\\\\ 6k &=-12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{6k}{\blueD{6}} &= \dfrac{-12}{\blueD{6}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $6$.}}\\\\ k &= \greenD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$k = \greenD{   -2    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    r   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 16-2r&=-3r+6r+1 \\\\  16-2r&=3r+1&&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 16-2r \blueD{-3r} &= 3r+1\blueD{-3r} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $3r$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5r+16&=1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -5r+16\blueD{-16} &= 1\blueD{-16} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $16$ from each side.}}\\\\ -5r &=-15 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-5r}{\blueD{-5}} &= \dfrac{-15}{\blueD{-5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-5$.}}\\\\ r &= \greenD{3} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ r= \greenD{   3    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $  e     $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 9e+4&=-5e+14+13e\\\\ 9e+4&=14+8e &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 9e+4 \blueD{-8e} &= 14+8e\blueD{-8e} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $8e$ from each side.}}\\\\ e+4&=14 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ e+4\blueD{-4} &= 14\blueD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $4$ from each side.}}\\\\ e &=\greenD{10} &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$e = \greenD{    10   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   c   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 6c+14&=-5c+4+9c\\\\ 6c+14&=4+4c &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 6c+14 \blueD{-4c} &= 4+4c\blueD{-4c} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $4c$ from each side.}}\\\\ 2c+14&=4 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2c+14\blueD{-14} &= 4\blueD{-14} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $14$ from each side.}}\\\\ 2c &=-10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2c}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{-10}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $2$.}}\\\\ c &= \greenD{-5} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$c = \greenD{  -5     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $    t   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 16-2t&=t+9+4t\\\\ 16-2t&=5t+9&&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 16-2t \blueD{-5t} &= 5t+9\blueD{-5t} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $5t$ from each side.}}\\\\ -7t+16&=9 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -7t+16\blueD{-16} &= 9\blueD{-16} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $16$ from each side.}}\\\\ -7t &=-7 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-7t}{\blueD{-7}} &= \dfrac{-7}{\blueD{-7}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-7$.}}\\\\ t &= \greenD{1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ t= \greenD{      1 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $  p     $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 17-2p&=2p+5+2p\\\\ 17-2p&=4p+5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 17-2p \blueD{-4p} &= 4p+5\blueD{-4p} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $4p$ from each side.}}\\\\ -6p+17&=5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -6p+17\blueD{-17} &= 5\blueD{-17} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract $17$ from each side.}}\\\\ -6p &=-12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-6p}{\blueD{-6}} &= \dfrac{-12}{\blueD{-6}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by $-6$.}}\\\\ p &= \greenD{2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ p= \greenD{    2   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]

item.problemType: like terms on same side of equation
